benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/bundles - Retrieve bundles for account

covered: Primary success flows: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06 exercise retrieval with no params, externalKey/bundlesFilter filters, audit levels (NONE default, FULL, MINIMAL) and combined parameters.
Response shape and schema: TC01 and TC25 validate response is a JSON array of Bundle objects and that required Bundle fields conform to the Bundle definition.
Empty / small result sets: TC07 (no bundles) and TC08 (single bundle) verify empty and single-item responses.
Path parameter validation and not-found handling: TC09 covers malformed UUID -> 400 and TC10 covers non-existent account -> 404.
Authentication and basic auth failures: TC13 covers missing/invalid token -> 401.
Query parameter validation for audit: TC11 tests unsupported audit values -> 400.
Resilience & dependency handling: TC14 (503 service down), TC21 (502 dependency failure), and TC17 (504 timeout) cover backend/unavailable service scenarios.
Security input validation: TC15 addresses malicious payload / injection attempts in query parameters.
Scale & performance: TC16 exercises a large dataset (>1000 bundles) and asserts response time SLAs.
Concurrency & consistency: TC18 validates concurrent GETs return consistent results.
Regression & data consistency: TC19 and TC22 validate previously fixed bugs and that newly created bundles are visible via GET.
Edge cases & input permutations: TC23 and TC24 explore empty query values and special-character inputs.
Backward compatibility & documentation: TC20 and TC25 cover older client behavior and OpenAPI/Swagger compliance.
gaps: Pagination: There are no tests for pagination controls (limit/offset/page tokens), paging metadata (Link headers, total counts) or correctness of paged responses — important for large data sets.
Caching behavior and conditional GET: No tests assert ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified headers or conditional GET semantics (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests to exercise rate limits (429 Too Many Requests) or Retry-After behavior under request bursts.
Authorization scope/permissions (403): Tests only cover missing token (401); there is no test for valid credentials with insufficient permissions resulting in 403.

Response headers & content negotiation: Tests do not explicitly assert Content-Type (application/json), Accept header handling, or other important headers (Content-Length, correlation/request IDs, Content-Encoding).
Internal server error (500) handling: No explicit test simulating an unexpected server error (500) and verifying error structure and logging/diagnostics are returned.
Pagination/performance interplay & stable ordering: Large-volume test returns all bundles but does not validate deterministic ordering or stable results across paged requests.
Rate-limited concurrency and burst behavior: Concurrency is tested, but not under throttling/rate-limited conditions to confirm graceful degradation.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create large number of bundles and exercise limit/offset or page-token endpoints, assert page sizes, Link or pagination headers, total counts, and consistent ordering across pages.

Add caching & conditional GET tests: assert presence of ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers and verify conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304) and cache invalidation after create/update/delete.
Add rate-limiting tests: generate request bursts to trigger 429 responses and verify Retry-After header and client-visible error format.
Add permission-scope tests (403): use valid tokens with insufficient scopes/roles to ensure 403 Forbidden is returned with an informative error body.

Assert response headers and content negotiation: explicitly verify Content-Type: application/json, Content-Encoding (gzip) if supported, presence of correlation/request-id headers, and behavior for unsupported Accept headers (e.g., 406).
Add server-error (500) scenario tests: simulate an unexpected server-side exception or DB failure and verify a 500 response with consistent error payload and monitoring/logging hooks.
Extend large-data tests to cover pagination performance and ordering: measure per-page latency within SLA and ensure no duplicates/missing items when walking pages.
Add stress & throttling concurrency tests: run high concurrency while asserting service responds gracefully (some 429/503 expected under overload) and that data consistency is preserved.
Add caching invalidation integration tests: create/update/delete bundles and verify cached GET responses change (ETag/Last-Modified) or are invalidated.
Document and assert exact error payloads and fields for all error cases (400/401/403/404/429/500/502/503/504) so clients can reliably parse and handle errors.
